greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n gives coefficients (lowest degree first) of P_n(x), where P_0(x) = P_1(x) = 1; P_n(x) = P_{n-1}(x) + x^n*P_{n-2}(x).
comment: P_n(x) appears to have degree A035106(n).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9523 (rows n=0..47 of triangle, flattened).
A. V. Sills, Finite Rogers-Ramanujan type identities, Electron. J. Combin. 10 (2003), Research Paper 13, 122 pp. See Identity 3-14, p. 25.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Rogers-Ramanujan Continued Fraction
maple: P[0]:=1; P[1]:=1; d:=[0,0]; M:=14; for n from 2 to M do P[n]:=expand(P[n-1]+q^n*P[n-2]);
xref: Rows converge to A003114 (coefficients in expansion of the first Rogers-Ramanujan identities). Cf. A119469.
Rows converge to A003106. Cf. A127836, A119469.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 24 2007
